page.title: 01Coddenham/Hemingstone area
page.content: This block as a whole is primarily farmland. Contains two pretty villages with narrow roads, numerous farms, country houses and two Estates; family home of the largest, converted into a Health Clinic in 1966, attracting National celebreties. The owners still run it. Largest village, Coddenham, nestling in rich undulating countryside, has a very impressive Church and a few shops. A Roman road passes through, leading from the remains of a Roman settlement to the West. In the East, the small village of Hemingstone has an interesting old Church, cottages and a large Fruit Farm. Well cultivated fields, ancient hedgerows and scattered woods. Popular with tourists in cars, cycling or on foot. Typical Suffolk cottages and timber framed houses to be seen. Towns of Needham Market and Ipswich near.
